txt.en: 'My husband has still not returned home! You cannot trust a word that faithless man says. I am sure he is still drinking in this city's underbelly!'
Hanâth is waiting at The Din of Arms in the Tor-gardens, in the western side of Umbar Baharbêl.\n\nHanâth will surely be grateful to hear her husband has returned home.
Baziphâr is likely still hiding in Tâkhdar, below Dâr Laja.\n\nFind Baziphâr and scold him for hiding below the city.
Search for Baziphâr below Dâr Laja in Tâkhdar
Scold Baziphâr and convince him to return home
'My husband has still not returned home! You cannot trust a word that faithless man says. I am sure he is still drinking in this city's underbelly!'
Baziphâr is likely still hiding in Tâkhdar below Dâr Laja.\n\nFind Baziphâr and scold him for hiding below the city.
You chide Baziphâr for avoiding his responsibilities

'Here I am, just as I have promised you to tell my wife... it is near enough, is it not?\n\n'My wife... I cannot join her inside the Din of Arms! The owner and I have a.... misunderstanding. Tell her I will be at home. No, I swear! I will be at home. I need to... lie down.'

'Baziphâr is at our house? You are certain? He has promised? I am so glad to hear. Thank you for returning my troublesome man home to me. I know he is a handful, but he is my handful. I should go home now to tend to his no-doubt-aching head, and remind him to stop harassing customers and businesses! Who does that, anyway?'
Baziphâr is likely still hiding in Tâkhdar, below Dâr Laja.\n\nBaziphâr has agreed to return home, but you have a sneaking suspicion he needs to be scolded into compliance.
Baziphâr is still hiding in Tâkhdar below Dâr Laja.

'Are we drinking one last time together? No? You said my wife is... hm. You and I are friends, but we will not be if you tell me to go home. The scolding I shall receive! No, no, I cannot bear it.\n\n'But you are right, of course. No, I need no assistance. I will... err, find my way there myself, yes. Do not help me! I will be... elsewhere, ho ho!'
'You have found my husband? He has not yet arrived. Perhaps his drunken self has gotten lost? Please hurry! I miss that besotted fool and I do not wish him robbed further blind!'
'I will go home once I see you have spoken to my wife. I do not want you to send hounds after me if you fear I have vanished. But please do not take too long. My head hurts.'
